issue.title: nbviewer.jupyter.org cannot read the pyecharts
issue.body:
# Troubleshooting

## Describe your environment

* Operating system: Windos10
* Python version:3.6
* Jupyter notebook or not? [Y/N]:Y


I have tried the method in the previous issue but it doesn't work.
Here is the code:

```
from pyecharts import Bar
pd_df3 = df2.groupby(['address'])['comments_num'].sum().reset_index().sort_values("comments_num",ascending=False)
pd_df2 = df2.groupby(['address'])['score'].mean().reset_index().sort_values("score",ascending=False)

attr = pd_df2.address
v1 = pd_df2.score
v2 = pd_df3.comments_num
bar = Bar("Area by score and comments")
bar.add("by score", attr, v1, mark_line=["average"])
bar.add("by comments_num", attr, v2, mark_line=["average"])
bar.render('osakahotel.html')
from IPython.display import IFrame
IFrame('osakahotel.html', width=800, height=400)
bar
```

issue.title: Problems about wordcloud
issue.body:
Here is my code:
```
from wordcloud import WordCloud
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
text = open('keywords.csv','r').read()
wordcloud = WordCloud().generate(text)
plt.imshow(wordcloud)
plt.axis('off')
plt.show()

wordcloud.to_file('Osaka.jpg')
```
The value Error is : We need at least 1 word to plot a word cloud, got 0.
Thank you very much!

comment.body: Thank you! The problem has been solved!

issue.title: Problems about wordcloud
issue.body:
Here is my code:
```
from wordcloud import WordCloud
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
text = open('keywords.csv','r').read()
wordcloud = WordCloud().generate(text)
plt.imshow(wordcloud)
plt.axis('off')
plt.show()

wordcloud.to_file('Osaka.jpg')
```
The value Error is : We need at least 1 word to plot a word cloud, got 0.
Thank you very much!

issue.title: Some problems about turning page
issue.body:
Here is my codes. I find that when turning pages it stops at the 3rd page.  I tried a lot but could not find the reason. Thank you! @ChicoXYC 
```
from selenium import webdriver
from selenium.common.exceptions import StaleElementReferenceException, NoSuchElementException
import time

def get_by_css(session, css, text=True):
    try:
        MAX_TRY = 3
        t = 0
        while t < MAX_TRY:
            t += 1
            try:
                res = session.find_element_by_css_selector(css)
            except StaleElementReferenceException:
                time.sleep(2)
                continue
            break
        if t == MAX_TRY:
            return None
    except NoSuchElementException:
        return None
    if text:
        return res.text
    return res

def get_hotels_from_browser(b):

    hotels = []
    for session in b.find_elements_by_css_selector('.sr_item.sr_item_new.sr_item_default.sr_property_block.sr_flex_layout'):
        hotel = {}
        name = get_by_css(session, 'span.sr-hotel__name')
        score = get_by_css(session, '.bui-review-score__badge')
        comments = get_by_css(session, '.bui-review-score__text')
        address = get_by_css(session, '.jq_tooltip.district_link.visited_link')
        price = get_by_css(session, '.price.availprice.no_rack_rate')
        if not price:
            price = get_by_css(session, '.price.scarcity_color')

        hotel['name'] = name
        hotel['score'] = score
        hotel['comments'] = comments
        hotel['address'] = address
        hotel['price'] = price

        hotels.append(hotel)
    return hotels

url = 'https://www.booking.com/searchresults.zh-cn.html?aid=378266&label=booking-name-IquAp*EbiLS6jPVl_he8yQS267778093594%3Apl%3Ata%3Ap1%3Ap2%3Aac%3Aap1t1%3Aneg%3Afi%3Atikwd-65526620%3Alp9061634%3Ali%3Adec%3Adm&sid=75a6a10fd83d509dc44f2bc75e94dc31&checkin_month=9&checkin_monthday=12&checkin_year=2019&checkout_month=9&checkout_monthday=13&checkout_year=2019&city=-240905&class_interval=1&dest_id=-240905&dest_type=city&from_sf=1&group_adults=2&group_children=0&label_click=undef&no_rooms=1&raw_dest_type=city&room1=A%2CA&sb_price_type=total&shw_aparth=1&slp_r_match=0&src=searchresults&srpvid=342a6023a36e0036&ss=%E5%A4%A7%E9%98%AA&ssb=empty&ssne=%E5%A4%A7%E9%98%AA&ssne_untouched=%E5%A4%A7%E9%98%AA&nflt=di%3D7322%3Bpri%3D2%3B&rsf=pri-2&lsf=pri%7C2%7C136'
browser = webdriver.Chrome()
browser.get(url)
time.sleep(2)

all_page_hotels = []
for i in range(7):
    new_hotels= get_hotels_from_browser(browser)
    all_page_hotels.extend(new_hotels)
    time.sleep(0.5)
    no_survey = get_by_css(browser, '.survey_no_button', False)
    if no_survey:
        no_survey.click()
    time.sleep(0.5)
    browser.execute_script('window.scrollTo(0, document.body.scrollHeight/1.5);')
    next_page = browser.find_element_by_css_selector('.bui-pagination__item.bui-pagination__next-arrow')

    next_page.click()

print(all_page_hotels)

```

```
from selenium import webdriver
from selenium.common.exceptions import StaleElementReferenceException, NoSuchElementException
import time

def get_by_css(session, css, text=True):
    try:
        MAX_TRY = 3
        t = 0
        while t < MAX_TRY:
            t += 1

            except StaleElementReferenceException:
                time.sleep(2)
                continue

    if text:
        return res.text
    return res

    hotels = []
    for session in b.find_elements_by_css_selector('.sr_item.sr_item_new.sr_item_default.sr_property_block.sr_flex_layout'):
        hotel = {}
        name = get_by_css(session, 'span.sr-hotel__name')
        score = get_by_css(session, '.bui-review-score__badge')
        comments = get_by_css(session, '.bui-review-score__text')
        address = get_by_css(session, '.jq_tooltip.district_link.visited_link')
        price = get_by_css(session, '.price.availprice.no_rack_rate')
        if not price:
            price = get_by_css(session, '.price.scarcity_color')

        hotel['name'] = name
        hotel['score'] = score
        hotel['comments'] = comments
        hotel['address'] = address
        hotel['price'] = price

browser = webdriver.Chrome()
browser.get(url)
time.sleep(2)

all_page_hotels = []
for i in range(7):
    new_hotels= get_hotels_from_browser(browser)
    all_page_hotels.extend(new_hotels)
    time.sleep(0.5)
    no_survey = get_by_css(browser, '.survey_no_button', False)
    if no_survey:
        no_survey.click()
    time.sleep(0.5)
    browser.execute_script('window.scrollTo(0, document.body.scrollHeight/1.5);')
    next_page = browser.find_element_by_css_selector('.bui-pagination__item.bui-pagination__next-arrow')

    next_page.click()

print(all_page_hotels)

```

Here is my codes. I find that when turning pages it stops at the 3rd page.  I tried a lot but could not find the reason. Thank you! @ChicoXYC 
```
from selenium import webdriver
from selenium.common.exceptions import StaleElementReferenceException, NoSuchElementException
import time

def get_by_css(session, css, text=True):
    try:
        MAX_TRY = 3
        t = 0
        while t < MAX_TRY:
            t += 1
            try:
                res = session.find_element_by_css_selector(css)
            except StaleElementReferenceException:
                time.sleep(2)
                continue
            break
        if t == MAX_TRY:
            return None
    except NoSuchElementException:
        return None
    if text:
        return res.text
    return res

def get_hotels_from_browser(b):

    hotels = []
    for session in b.find_elements_by_css_selector('.sr_item.sr_item_new.sr_item_default.sr_property_block.sr_flex_layout'):
        hotel = {}

        score = get_by_css(session, '.bui-review-score__badge')
        comments = get_by_css(session, '.bui-review-score__text')
        address = get_by_css(session, '.jq_tooltip.district_link.visited_link')
        price = get_by_css(session, '.price.availprice.no_rack_rate')
        if not price:
            price = get_by_css(session, '.price.scarcity_color')

        hotel['name'] = name
        hotel['score'] = score
        hotel['comments'] = comments
        hotel['address'] = address
        hotel['price'] = price

        hotels.append(hotel)
    return hotels

time.sleep(2)

for i in range(7):
    new_hotels= get_hotels_from_browser(browser)
    all_page_hotels.extend(new_hotels)

```
from selenium import webdriver
from selenium.common.exceptions import StaleElementReferenceException, NoSuchElementException
import time

def get_by_css(session, css, text=True):
    try:

        hotel['name'] = name
        hotel['score'] = score
        hotel['comments'] = comments

issue.title: A question about Booking scraping
issue.body:
from selenium import webdriver

browser = webdriver.Chrome()
browser.get('https://www.booking.com/searchresults.zh-cn.html?aid=378266&label=booking-name-IquAp*EbiLS6jPVl_he8yQS267778093594%3Apl%3Ata%3Ap1%3Ap2%3Aac%3Aap1t1%3Aneg%3Afi%3Atikwd-65526620%3Alp9061634%3Ali%3Adec%3Adm&sid=75a6a10fd83d509dc44f2bc75e94dc31&checkin_month=9&checkin_monthday=12&checkin_year=2019&checkout_month=9&checkout_monthday=13&checkout_year=2019&city=-240905&class_interval=1&dest_id=-240905&dest_type=city&from_sf=1&group_adults=2&group_children=0&label_click=undef&no_rooms=1&raw_dest_type=city&room1=A%2CA&sb_price_type=total&shw_aparth=1&slp_r_match=0&src=searchresults&srpvid=342a6023a36e0036&ss=%E5%A4%A7%E9%98%AA&ssb=empty&ssne=%E5%A4%A7%E9%98%AA&ssne_untouched=%E5%A4%A7%E9%98%AA&nflt=di%3D7322%3Bpri%3D2%3B&rsf=pri-2&lsf=pri%7C2%7C136')

hotels = []
for session in browser.find_elements_by_css_selector('#hotellist_inner.hotellist sr_double_search'):
    hotel = {}
    n = session.find_element_by_css_selector('span.sr-hotel__name')
    hotel['name'] = n.text
    hotel['score'] = session.find_element_by_css_selector('div.bui-review-score__badge').text
    hotels.append(hotel)
hotels

**I  use the selenium to scrape the information on Booking, but the output is [ ].  I got no error message , just the empty [ ]. Could someone find is there anything wrong with it? Thank you!**

issue.title: A question about Booking scraping
issue.body:
from selenium import webdriver

browser = webdriver.Chrome()
browser.get('https://www.booking.com/searchresults.zh-cn.html?aid=378266&label=booking-name-IquAp*EbiLS6jPVl_he8yQS267778093594%3Apl%3Ata%3Ap1%3Ap2%3Aac%3Aap1t1%3Aneg%3Afi%3Atikwd-65526620%3Alp9061634%3Ali%3Adec%3Adm&sid=75a6a10fd83d509dc44f2bc75e94dc31&checkin_month=9&checkin_monthday=12&checkin_year=2019&checkout_month=9&checkout_monthday=13&checkout_year=2019&city=-240905&class_interval=1&dest_id=-240905&dest_type=city&from_sf=1&group_adults=2&group_children=0&label_click=undef&no_rooms=1&raw_dest_type=city&room1=A%2CA&sb_price_type=total&shw_aparth=1&slp_r_match=0&src=searchresults&srpvid=342a6023a36e0036&ss=%E5%A4%A7%E9%98%AA&ssb=empty&ssne=%E5%A4%A7%E9%98%AA&ssne_untouched=%E5%A4%A7%E9%98%AA&nflt=di%3D7322%3Bpri%3D2%3B&rsf=pri-2&lsf=pri%7C2%7C136')

for session in browser.find_elements_by_css_selector('#hotellist_inner.hotellist sr_double_search'):
    hotel = {}
    n = session.find_element_by_css_selector('span.sr-hotel__name')
    hotel['name'] = n.text
    hotel['score'] = session.find_element_by_css_selector('div.bui-review-score__badge').text
    hotels.append(hotel)
hotels

comment.body: > @Shinonomee I think its mainly because you write wrong css selector > > > from outter to inner, upper to lower > the line you wrote is wrong with level`('#hotellist_inner.hotellist sr_double_search'). > > @hupili there is a problem about css selector. If I write the css with the way you taught me, the element cannot be found. But with xpath it works. And also if i wirte use the `css styles` in dev tools, it works too! So, whats wrong this the first solution？ Details please check out here: > https://nbviewer.jupyter.org/github/ChicoXYC/exercise/blob/master/css%20selector.ipynb > > > @Shinonomee I think its mainly because you write wrong css selector > > > from outter to inner, upper to lower > the line you wrote is wrong with level`('#hotellist_inner.hotellist sr_double_search'). > > @hupili there is a problem about css selector. If I write the css with the way you taught me, the element cannot be found. But with xpath it works. And also if i wirte use the `css styles` in dev tools, it works too! So, whats wrong this the first solution？ Details please check out here: > https://nbviewer.jupyter.org/github/ChicoXYC/exercise/blob/master/css%20selector.ipynb > > from selenium import webdriver browser = webdriver.Chrome() browser.get('https://www.booking.com/searchresults.zh-cn.html?aid=378266&label=booking-name-IquAp*EbiLS6jPVl_he8yQS267778093594%3Apl%3Ata%3Ap1%3Ap2%3Aac%3Aap1t1%3Aneg%3Afi%3Atikwd-65526620%3Alp9061634%3Ali%3Adec%3Adm&sid=75a6a10fd83d509dc44f2bc75e94dc31&checkin_month=9&checkin_monthday=12&checkin_year=2019&checkout_month=9&checkout_monthday=13&checkout_year=2019&city=-240905&class_interval=1&dest_id=-240905&dest_type=city&from_sf=1&group_adults=2&group_children=0&label_click=undef&no_rooms=1&raw_dest_type=city&room1=A%2CA&sb_price_type=total&shw_aparth=1&slp_r_match=0&src=searchresults&srpvid=342a6023a36e0036&ss=%E5%A4%A7%E9%98%AA&ssb=empty&ssne=%E5%A4%A7%E9%98%AA&ssne_untouched=%E5%A4%A7%E9%98%AA&nflt=di%3D7322%3Bpri%3D2%3B&rsf=pri-2&lsf=pri%7C2%7C136') hotels = [] for session in browser.find_elements_by_css_selector('#hotellist_inner.sr_item sr_item_new sr_item_default sr_property_block sr_flex_layout'): hotel = {} n = session.find_element_by_css_selector('span.sr-hotel__name') hotel['name'] = n.text hotel['score'] = session.find_element_by_css_selector('div.bui-review-score__badge').text hotels.append(hotel) hotels **I modified it but the output is still the empty [ ]. And when I use css selector just to find elements under the id hotellist_inner, I find that it cannot find all the 25 hotels on this page. What's the reason? Thanks!**

issue.title: A question about Booking scraping
issue.body:
from selenium import webdriver

browser = webdriver.Chrome()
browser.get('https://www.booking.com/searchresults.zh-cn.html?aid=378266&label=booking-name-IquAp*EbiLS6jPVl_he8yQS267778093594%3Apl%3Ata%3Ap1%3Ap2%3Aac%3Aap1t1%3Aneg%3Afi%3Atikwd-65526620%3Alp9061634%3Ali%3Adec%3Adm&sid=75a6a10fd83d509dc44f2bc75e94dc31&checkin_month=9&checkin_monthday=12&checkin_year=2019&checkout_month=9&checkout_monthday=13&checkout_year=2019&city=-240905&class_interval=1&dest_id=-240905&dest_type=city&from_sf=1&group_adults=2&group_children=0&label_click=undef&no_rooms=1&raw_dest_type=city&room1=A%2CA&sb_price_type=total&shw_aparth=1&slp_r_match=0&src=searchresults&srpvid=342a6023a36e0036&ss=%E5%A4%A7%E9%98%AA&ssb=empty&ssne=%E5%A4%A7%E9%98%AA&ssne_untouched=%E5%A4%A7%E9%98%AA&nflt=di%3D7322%3Bpri%3D2%3B&rsf=pri-2&lsf=pri%7C2%7C136')

hotels = []
for session in browser.find_elements_by_css_selector('#hotellist_inner.hotellist sr_double_search'):
    n = session.find_element_by_css_selector('span.sr-hotel__name')
    hotel['name'] = n.text
    hotel['score'] = session.find_element_by_css_selector('div.bui-review-score__badge').text
    hotels.append(hotel)
hotels

**I  use the selenium to scrape the information on Booking, but the output is [ ].  I got no error message , just the empty [ ]. Could someone find is there anything wrong with it? Thank you!**
